result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfred C Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alfred C Peterson

defendant.name: Peterson, Alfred C
defendant.address: 4871 S Cave Point Dr, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Emails between CoC/DA re: domestic abuse surcharge - not included
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Alfred C Peterson in court with attorney David R. Clowers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, finds basis to accept plea, withholds acceptance of plea, reviews conditions contained within DAGPA. Discussion regarding violent contact/timeline of assessments. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State advises that case can be resolved by written stipulation if all conditions have been met. State advises of victim input. Bond continues as is.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Alfred C Peterson in court with attorney David R. Clowers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense advises of previous representation of Defendant by Judge Weber, addresses page missing from narrative report. Judge addresses previous representation, does not believe it would prevent him from being fair and impartial. State advises that missing page will be included with discovery. Defense enters not guilty pleas. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant called, is staying at Lullaby Inn in Egg Harbor for 2 nights.

No contact direct or indirect with MP or 4871 S. Cave Point Drive until 8:00 p.m. on Tuesday 10/25/16. After 8:00 p.m. on 10/15/16, no violent contact with MP. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Alfred C Peterson appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/7/16, 10:00.
